meanings.definition: To spend more money than is available.
meanings.sent1: She overspent on clothes and had no money left for food.
meanings.sent2: He always overspends during the holidays and regrets it later.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overspent on acorns and had to borrow some from the chipmunk.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overspent her energy, leaving her breathless.
meanings.sent5: The river overspent its banks, flooding the nearby fields.

meanings.definition: Having spent more money than is available.
meanings.sent1: The overspent shopper had to return some items to stay within budget.
meanings.sent2: She felt stressed and anxious after realizing she was overspent.
meanings.sent3: The overspent piggy bank looked sad and empty on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: His overspent enthusiasm for the project faded as challenges arose.
meanings.sent5: The overspent wallet bulged with receipts and empty of cash.
